spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mordakhesh's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). Mordakhesh can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Any time Mordakhesh is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, Mordakhesh is unaffected. On a 6, Mordakesh is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from Mordakesh, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Mordakhesh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Mordakesh fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Chromatic Orb
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage of a type chosen by Mordakhesh: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Mordakhesh makes one weapon attack or casts chromatic orb.

legendary.name: Chromatic Resistance
entries: Modakhesh gains immunity to one damage type of his choice until the start of his next turn.

legendary.name: Warlord's Command (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Mordakhesh targets up to two allies that he can see within 30 feet of him. If a target can see and hear him, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

In the age when fiends and dragons waged war across Eberron, rakshasas served the fiendish lords as strategists and generals. A rakshasa named Mordakhesh rose up through the ranks to become one of the greatest commanders of his age, and a dragon-slaying specialist. For this, he earned the nickname Shadowsword, along with a legendary reputation for leaving death in his wake.

Mordakhesh serves as the prakhutu or "speaker" of his imprisoned master, Rak Tulkhesh, and he seeks to free his lord by bathing the world in blood. Like a spider with multiple webs, he has agents and pawns (which he calls his "claws") established in armies across Khorvaire. The most significant of those is the barbarian horde he amasses in the Demon Wastes—warriors who threaten to sweep into Aundair on a tide of blood.

Many of the horrors of the Last War were instigated—or at least encouraged—by Mordakhesh's operatives, and his claws are known to have perpetrated some of the most brutal massacres of that conflict. No one knows how far the Shadowsword's reach extends, or which commanders in the armies of Khorvaire serve him.
